byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and ERIC DASH

abstract: Many Wall Street bankers view the Occupy Wall Street protests as either an unsophisticated fringe movement, a symptom of suffering that they cannot alleviate, or a personal attack; their differing world views highlight the wide gap that has opened over who is to blame for continuing economic malaise and what is best for the country.
snippet: As the demonstrations grow, the different worldviews of bankers show the wide chasms that have opened over who is to blame for economic malaise.
lead_paragraph: As the demonstrations grow, the different worldviews of bankers show the wide chasms that have opened over who is to blame for economic malaise.

headline.main: In Private, Wall St. Bankers Dismiss Protesters as Unsophisticated
headline.print_headline: In Private, Wall St. Bankers Dismiss Protesters as Unsophisticated
headline.seo: In Private Conversation, Wall Street Is More Critical of Protesters
